pytket.backends.projectq¶

Backend for utilising the ProjectQ simulator directly from pytket

class pytket.backends.projectq.ProjectQBackend¶
get_operator_expectation_value(state_circuit, operator, shots=10000) → float¶

Calculates expectation value for an OpenFermion QubitOperator by summing over pauli expectations Note: This method is significantly faster using the ProjectQBackend than the AerStateBackend.

get_pauli_expectation_value(state_circuit, pauli, shots=10000) → float¶

Calculates expectation value for pauli term by preparing basis change circuit and measuring

run(circuit: pytket._circuit.Circuit, shots: int, fit_to_constraints=True) → numpy.ndarray¶

Run the circuit on the backend and return results, optionally fitting the circuit to the constraints of the backend.

Parameters:
  • circuit (Circuit) – The circuit to run
  • shots (int) – Number of shots (repeats) to run
  • fit_to_constraints (bool, optional) – Compile the circuit to meet the constraints of the backend, defaults to True
Returns:

Table of shot results, each row is a shot, columns are ordered by qubit ordering. Values are 0 or 1 corresponding to qubit basis states.
Return type:

numpy.ndarray
